title: World Records
description: How well do you know these amazing world records?

questions.question: What is the tallest building in the world as of 2024?
questions.explanation: The Burj Khalifa in Dubai stands at 2,717 feet (828 meters) tall and has held the record as the world's tallest building since its completion in 2010.

questions.question: What is the longest river in the world?
questions.explanation: The Nile River in Africa is generally considered the longest river in the world at approximately 4,130 miles (6,650 km), though some measurements suggest the Amazon may be longer.

questions.question: What is the largest ocean on Earth?
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean, covering about 63 million square miles. It is larger than all of Earth's landmass combined.

questions.question: What country has the largest population in the world?
questions.explanation: India surpassed China as the world's most populous country in 2023, with over 1.4 billion people.

questions.question: What is the fastest land animal?
questions.explanation: The cheetah is the fastest land animal, capable of reaching speeds up to 70 mph (112 km/h) in short bursts covering distances up to 500 meters.

questions.question: What is the deepest point in the world's oceans?
questions.explanation: The Mariana Trench in the Pacific Ocean contains the Challenger Deep, the deepest known point at approximately 36,000 feet (about 11,000 meters) below sea level.

questions.question: What is the largest desert in the world (by total area)?
questions.explanation: Antarctica is technically the world's largest desert at about 5.5 million square miles. A desert is defined by low precipitation, not temperature. The Sahara is the largest hot desert.

questions.question: Who holds the record for the most Olympic gold medals ever won?
questions.explanation: Michael Phelps holds the all-time record with 23 Olympic gold medals (and 28 total medals) earned across five Olympic Games from 2000 to 2016.

questions.question: What is the largest living organism on Earth by area?
questions.explanation: A honey fungus (Armillaria ostoyae) in Oregon's Blue Mountains covers about 2,385 acres (about 3.7 square miles), making it the largest known living organism by area.

questions.question: What is the hottest temperature ever recorded on Earth?
questions.explanation: The highest temperature ever recorded was 134°F (56.7°C) at Furnace Creek Ranch in Death Valley, California, on July 10, 1913.

questions.question: What is the smallest country in the world by area?
questions.explanation: Vatican City is the smallest country in the world at just 0.17 square miles (0.44 square km). It is an independent city-state within Rome, Italy.

questions.question: What is the longest-running TV show in U.S. history (by number of episodes)?
questions.explanation: General Hospital, which premiered in 1963, holds the record for the most episodes of any American TV show, with over 15,000 episodes.

questions.question: What is the largest animal to have ever lived on Earth?
questions.explanation: The blue whale is the largest animal to have ever lived on Earth, reaching lengths of up to 100 feet and weighing up to 200 tons — larger than any dinosaur.

questions.question: What is the oldest known living tree species?
questions.explanation: Bristlecone pines are the oldest known living trees. The oldest individual, named Methuselah, is over 4,850 years old, located in California's White Mountains.

questions.question: What is the longest distance ever walked without stopping (Guinness World Record)?
questions.explanation: The Guinness World Record for the longest distance walked without stopping is approximately 350 miles (563 km), achieved over several days of continuous walking without sleep.
